abstract: Chinese real estate tycoon Wang Jianlin tells audience at Harvard University that Pres Xi Jinping's relatives sold their stake in his company, Dalian Wanda Commercial Properties, months before initial public offering and denies any corruption was involved; statement is meant as refutation of New York Times investigation into possible political ties that led to company's rapid growth.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Wang said President Xi Jinping’s relatives had sold their shares in his company two months before its initial public offering, missing out on a “fortune” in capital gains.

headline.main: Chinese Tycoon Wang Jianlin Defends Xi’s Relatives, and Himself, on Business Deal
headline.print_headline: Chinese Tycoon Defends Xi’s Relatives, and Himself, on Business Deal

snippet: Mr. Wang said President Xi Jinping’s relatives had sold their shares in his company two months before its initial public offering, missing out on a “fortune” in capital gains.
